newsitem.title: JAPAN: Temporary forex move won't affect Japan trade - MITI.
newsitem.headline: Temporary forex move won't affect Japan trade - MITI.

text.p: A temporary movement in foreign exchange rates will not change Japan's trading patterns significantly, Vice Trade Minister Tsutomu Makino told a news conference on Monday.

Asked if the yen's sharp rise on Monday reflects Japan's economic fundamentals, Makino said exchange rates are fluctuating daily, so it is not wise to say whether a specific currency level reflects fundamentals or not.
"The dollar, which was at the 117 yen level this morning, is now back to the 119 yen level, so we will have to see how it goes for a while," he said.
The dollar's low in Monday morning Tokyo trade was 117.50 yen.
"Temporary moves in currency rates will not lead to a substantial change in Japan's trading patterns," Makino said.
"Japanese carmakers have established overseas production bases and this trading pattern is firmly built into Japan's trading system," he added.
